summary: This document is an email chain from October 31, 2019, concerning a discovery access issue for a defendant named Nick Tartaglione. Defense attorney Bruce Barket raises concerns with a federal prosecutor that his client has been denied access to discovery materials since October 18th, following their removal. The emails coordinate a call to resolve the matter.

persons.name: Bruce Barket
persons.context: Attorney representing Nick Tartaglione, raising concerns about his client's lack of access to discovery materials.

persons.name: Nick Tartaglione
persons.context: The individual whose access to legal discovery materials is the subject of the email dispute.

connections.description: Bruce Barket is the defense attorney advocating for Nick Tartaglione's access to discovery materials.

events.title: Discovery Taken from Tartaglione
events.description: Discovery materials were taken from defendant Nick Tartaglione, after which he allegedly had no access to them.

events.title: Email Dispute Over Discovery Access
events.description: Attorney Bruce Barket emails a federal prosecutor to report an ongoing problem with his client Nick Tartaglione being denied access to discovery.

locations: 1 St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: Defense attorney Bruce Barket reported that his client, Nick Tartaglione, had not been permitted to view his discovery materials since they were taken from him on October 18, 2019.
The correspondence indicates prior arrangements were made for Tartaglione to view discovery in an attorney conference the prior weekend, with plans to repeat the arrangement for the upcoming weekend.
The email chain shows coordination between a defense attorney and a federal prosecutor (Assistant United States Attorney) to schedule a call to resolve the discovery access issue.
